newsitem.title: CHINA: Shanghai shares end sharply down on Deng rumours.
newsitem.headline: Shanghai shares end sharply down on Deng rumours.

text.p: Shanghai's A and B share indices closed sharply down on Tuesday on market rumours about the health of Chinese leader Deng Xiaoping, brokers said.

The A share index lost 91.94 points or 8.97 percent to 932.783 on volume of 661.1 million shares worth 6.3 billion yuan. The B share index shed 4.754 points or 6.97 percent to 63.455 on volume of 42.8 million shares worth $20.1 million.

The indices opened higher against Monday's close but rumours on Deng's health began circulating around mid-morning, depressing market sentiment and driving prices down for the rest of the session, brokers said.
China's Foreign Ministry said on Tuesday there had been no major change in the health of 92-year-old paramount leader Deng Xiaoping.
"Buying retreated with the rumours, and liquidation selling pushed the index down sharply," one broker said. "Investors are very nervous about the rumours."
Another broker said the market was likely to rebound after the sharp falls if there is no major negative news.
Of 43 B shares, 42 traded with all falling.
Shanghai Industry Sewing Machine was the biggest loser, slipping $0.018 or 10.22 percent to $0.158 on volume of 139,000 shares.
Shanghai Chlor Alkali followed on institutional liquidation selling, falling $0.034 or 10.05 percent to $0.304 on volume of 1.8 million shares.
Shanghai Lujiazui Finance and Trade Zone Development traded the most on overseas selling, dipping $0.068 or 7.88 percent to $0.794 on volume of 3.4 million shares.
Shanghai A shares fell on the same factors with institutions taking profit and doing unwinding selling, brokers said.
The SSE 30 index slipped 254.175 points or 9.42 percent to 2443.012 points.
Beiman Special Steel was the biggest A share loser, falling 0.45 yuan or 10.06 percent to 4.02 yuan on volume of 11.4 million shares.
